tests.title: Linear Algebra: Test 1
tests.topics: Systems of linear equations, matirx operations, inverse matrix, eigenvalues, eigenvectors

questions.question: $$\begin{aligned} x + y +3z & = 0\\ x + 2y -2z & = 3\\ 3x +9y +k & = 19\end{aligned}$$
questions.prompt: Find the value of $\small \textbf{k}$ for which the following system has $\textbf{no solution}$.

questions.question: $A =\begin{bmatrix}0 & 0 & 1 & 0\\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 \\ -37 & 24 & -10 & 0 \\ 24 & -37 & 0 & -10 \end{bmatrix} \text{,  } \vec{x} = \begin{bmatrix}-8i\\8i\\48+40i\\-48-40i\end{bmatrix}$
questions.prompt: Find the $\small \textbf{eigenvalue}$ associated with the $\small \textbf{following eigenvector}$.
questions.extra: if your answer is a + bi, then enter a,b in the answer box (no spaces)

questions.question: $A =\begin{bmatrix}4 & -3 & 4\\ 0 &-4 & 0\\-1 & 7 & -1 \end{bmatrix}$
questions.prompt: Find the $\small \textbf{eigenvalues } \lambda$ of the following matrix.
questions.extra: separate your answers with a comma (least to greatest; no spaces)

questions.question: $$\begin{aligned} x_{1} -3x_{2} -6x_{3} + 8x_{4} & = 2\\ 4x_{1} -5x_{2} -7x_{3} + 5x_{4} & = 5\\ -8x_{1} +3x_{2} -3x_{3} + 17x_{4} & = -23\end{aligned}$$
questions.prompt: Determine whether the following $\small \textbf{linear system}$ has $\small \textbf{one solution, no solutions, or infinitely}$ many solutions.

questions.question: $A =\begin{bmatrix}1 & 1 & 5 & 9\\ -9 & 2 & -5 & 8\\9 & 7 & -1 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \text{,  } B = \begin{bmatrix}5 \\-6\\-1\\3 \end{bmatrix}$
questions.prompt: Compute the $\small \textbf{product}$ AB. $\textbf{Find }\boldsymbol{AB_{31}}$

questions.question: $A = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 1 & -2\\-10 & -1 & 4 \\ -2 & -1 & 2 \end{bmatrix}$
questions.prompt: Consider the following matrix $\small A$, and let $\small \boldsymbol {B= A^{−1}}$. $\small\text{Compute}$ $\small \boldsymbol{b_{31}+b_{32}+b_{33}}$.

questions.question: $C=\begin{bmatrix} a + 3g & -g & 3d \\ b +3h & -h & 3e \\ c+3i & -i & 3f \end{bmatrix}$
questions.prompt:
Suppose that $\small \boldsymbol{\det(A) = -3}$. Let $\small B$ be another 3 × 3 matrix (not given here) with $\small \boldsymbol{\det(B) = 4}$. 
Find $\small \boldsymbol{\det(C)}$

questions.question: $A = \begin{bmatrix} 8 & 8 & -1 \\ *& *& * \\ * & * & * \end{bmatrix}\text{,  }\vec{x} = \begin{bmatrix} 2 \\ -3 \\ -4\end{bmatrix}$
questions.prompt: Given that $\small \boldsymbol {\vec{x}}$ is an $\small \textbf{eigenvector}$ of the matrix $\small A$, what is the corresponding $\small \textbf{eigenvalue } \lambda$?

Let $\small A$ be a 4 × 13 matrix, and let $\small B$ be m × n. Suppose that $\small B^{T}A^{T}$ is a 24 x 4 matrix.
What is the value of $\small \boldsymbol{m}$?

questions.question: $A = \begin{bmatrix} \sqrt{2} & 2 & 1 \\ 6 & 1 & 4 \\ 1 & 8 & 3 \end{bmatrix}$
questions.prompt: Let $\small \boldsymbol{B = adj(A)}$. $\small \textbf{Find }  \boldsymbol{b_{33}}$?

tests.title: Calculus I: Test 2
tests.topics: Implicit/explicit integration, differential applications in optimization, critical points, intervals of concavity/increase/decrease, L'Hospital's Rule, Mean Value Theorem, and hyperbolic functions

questions.question: $f(x) = \ln(\ln{x^{x^{2}}})$
questions.prompt: What is the $\small \textbf{instantaneous rate of change}$ of $\small \boldsymbol{f(x)}$ at $\small \boldsymbol{x = e}$

questions.question: $\int_{0}^{1} \sqrt{x+10} \,dx$
questions.prompt: Which of the following $\small \textbf{limits}$ would correctly correspond the following $\small \textbf{integral}$.

questions.question: $\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}} \cosh{2x}\,dx$
questions.prompt: Use $\small \textbf{U-Substitution}$ to evaluate the following $\small \textbf{definite integral}$

questions.question: $\lim_{x\rightarrow \infty} (\frac{e^{x}}{\ln{x}})$
questions.prompt: $\small \textbf{Evaluate}$ the following $\small \textbf{limit}$

questions.question: $f(x) = \ln{3x} + \tan{2^{x}}$
questions.prompt: Determine $\small \boldsymbol{f'(x)}$

questions.question: $f(x) = \begin{cases} x^{3} + 2x^{2} -5 & 0 \leq x < 5 \\ \frac{1}{x^{2}} & 5 \leq x \end{cases}$
questions.prompt: At what point $(x,y)$ does the following $\small \textbf{piecewise function}$ have an $\small \textbf{absolute minimum}$?

questions.question: $f(x) = \sinh({\cosh{(\ln{(\ln{x})})}})$
questions.prompt: $\small \textbf{Evalute}$ the following function at $\small \boldsymbol{x = e^{2}}$.
Which of the following is $\small \textbf{false}$ regarding the satisfaction of the $\small \textbf{Mean Value Theorem}$?
questions.solution: $\footnotesize\text{If f(a) = f(b) then there always lies a point on (a,b) such that f'(c) = 1}$
questions.C: $\footnotesize \text{There is a point c on (a,b) such that f(b) - f(a) = f'(c)(b-a)}$
questions.D: $\footnotesize\text{If f(a) = f(b) then there always lies a point on (a,b) such that f'(c) = 1}$
questions.E: $\footnotesize \text{There is a point c on (a,b) such that }\frac{f(b)-f(a)}{f'(c)} = (-a+b)$

questions.question: $f(x)=\frac{x-4}{x^{2}-16x}$
questions.prompt: Find the $\small \textbf{intervals of increase}$ on $\small \boldsymbol{f(x)}$

A farmer with $\small \textbf{750 ft}$ of fencing wants to enclose a $\small \textbf{rectangular area}$ and then divide it into $\small \textbf{four pens}$ with fencing parallel to one side of the rectangle. Write an $\small \textbf{expression}$ for the $\small \textbf{total area}$ of the fence in terms of $\small \boldsymbol{x}$.

questions.question: $f(x) = \frac{1}{\ln{x}}$
questions.prompt: Find the intervals of $\small \textbf{downwards concanvity}$ of $\small \boldsymbol{f(x)}$.
